resources.string: Morse code is a method used in telecommunication to encode text characters as standardized sequences of two different signal durations, called dots and dashes, or dits and dahs. Morse code is named after Samuel Morse, one of the inventors of the telegraph.\n%1$s encoding is currently active (reference: %2$s).\nFollowing characters are available:
The length of dahs and spaces is defined in milliseconds as follows:

DAH length: %1$d ms
GAP between characters length: %2$d ms
WHITESPACE length: %3$d ms
END OF MESSAGE length: %4$d ms
